column5: Great report as always Cliff.   You certainly are a great net boy not only for family but friends as well.
That's just N I C E
Looks like you had fun.
Largemouth and Smallmouth bass are not open.  She caught a rock bass...which has the same rules as panfish.  They opened on the Kawarthas a few weeks ago.
Must be great to have a WHOLE FAMILY who enjoy fishing! Is the wee one part of any of the teams . . . .    I'd bet she'd love to contribute there!
In the words of Pierre McGuire on TSN...She's a monster!...A fishing monster that is  Great report and pics Cliff.  Congrats to the little one on a job well done.
Not part of the OFC Tourney....but she did place second in her first kids derby last summer!!

Another wonderful report and pictures. Next time the wind is out of the East and you still want to do some fishing, head up to our place. The water was like glass out in front of here all day untile about 8:30 last night when the wind changed to being out of the South. If you do want to go out in the boat, you can but the prize for catching the first fish of the season off our dock is a free season pass. As long as Sydney wants to bring you along, you and Carol can come too LOL!
Always great to see kids fishing! Nice report!

LOL Cliff...I suppose if I'm extra nice to her, she'll let me tag along.  I'll keep that east wind thing in mind..heck I may even call you to get a live report on conditions off your dock....thanks Cliff!
What a great report Cliff.  I love the family ones too.  Looks like it wasn't as windy there as on Simcoe.  Good stuff - net boy  Joey
That's a pretty cute report Cliff..  Well done! HD
Hey now!!! BE nice!!! LOL
Nice report and pics...first little girl I hear who likes to play with the guts  hahaha Congrats little one on your PB
Great stuff Cliff!

My little one has been asking all week when we could go in the boat again to fish, so we were hoping that the winds wouldn't be too bad out there today.  We arrived at the public boat launch in Port Perry....and happy to see that the docks had been put in.  A quick launch and we were off.  It became apparent as we were crossing the lake that much of the lake wouldn't be kid friendly with the strong east/southeast winds.  We found some sheltered areas to drift, but as soon as we hit that wind, it became pretty cold pretty fast.  We continued along close the shoreline until we found a weed  edge and we put the anchor down.  We set up our little ones rod with a bobber and worm, and before Bly and I had a chance to setup, she had her first fish on of the day....this little rock bass.  She's wearing my sweater in this pic....it's a bit big for her, but it helped keep her warm.   Here's the release shot...she wanted me to take this picture....   Not long after that the OPP came by to visit...it was pretty exciting...our first ever inspection with the boat...LOL.  They were very friendly, and kept on asking our little one if she caught any big fish yet.  A few minutes later, they were off, checking the other boats in the area.  She caught a few small perch before we landed our monsters....here's Bly's first fish ever in the boat....she's happy that's out of the way now.    I landed a few small ones, and then we decided to have our lunch.  After lunch, my little one puts her line in and after waiting intently, her bobber goes down FAST!  She sets the hook and lands this 12" perch!  This qualifies for her first ever Ontario Angler Awards certificate.  She said that she wanted to eat this fish, so we kept it for a fish fry.   The bite began to turn off, but Bly, being as smart as she is packed some bubbles for our little one....this worked magic for at least a little while.   The winds began to pick up something fierce (I found our later on that the gusts were up to 50 km/h).  We decided to head back towards the boat launch...and I'm glad we did.  The waves were getting pretty big and I had a hard time with the boat...trying not to soak everyone as we headed back.  The boat came out of the water pretty quickly, and we decided to fish from shore for a little while.  Our little one continued to kick our butts landing lots of fish this size...   The winds kicked in even more and the lake was filled with white caps.  Boats larger than ours began to come in, with guys saying the conditions were pretty much unfishable.  After we got in, she wanted me to clean the fish right away, so she got up on a chair and watched as used the filet knife.  She wanted the guts to play with, so out they came.  She then said "Hey daddy, that's strange, there's a fish tail in there".  Lo and behold, out came a little fish from the fish's stomach.  Here's a pic of her with her fried fish....her first fish fry.   We had a great day out there despite the weather.  I'm hoping for at least a few calm days out there this summer....because every time we head out, or want to head out winds are a huge problem.  Hope to get out there again soon!  This having a boat thing is great!  It beats sitting on shore all the time that's for sure!
Excellent report and pics Cliff!!!  Pretty soon you'll have all 3 of your women trained to hook big fish for you to reel in!!!
great report ccmt, thanks for sharing.
Shhhhhhhhhhhhhhh......don't let everyone know my secret!! Jeez Glen....  She caught not only the biggest fish of the day....she caught more than bly and I combined......
Great stuff Cliff! Good to see her outfish the masters!
Geez, that kid's a cutey! Way to go. Jim
Great report as allways Cliff.  She really is a cutie thats for sure .  I love to read the reports of moms & dads out fishing with they're little ones.
Good on her, and what a great way to spend mothers day.
Congrats to your daughter and her parents on a great day out.
Great report Cliff and beautiful pictures of your daughter holdind the fish  Rob

Well i think you guys have a pro fishergirl in training for sure  ,and hey cliff you are outnumbered now !!!! i dont think you stand a chance.  .LOL..LOL..LOL.. Congrats to sydney for that great catch !!!!!  cheers
great report. a joy to read
great report and congrats to your daughter
Great report nice always a treat to see your daughter smile ear to ear.  Where is the new cup holders
Excellent report, and great job by the little one getting all the big ones.
Great family report, and what a perch. Bet that tasted yummy. Taking the bubbles along is always a good idea.
Great report Cliff. Awesome way to spend Mom's day!  Unfortunately, you are going to be net boy pretty soon!
thanks for the report Cliff!

I really enjoyed reading your report this morning. Need to get my kids out next weekend, fishing is a far more enjoyable family activity compared to the pressure cooker kids organized sports has become.
Congrats on the PB!!  Good on ya's for getting her out! She seems like a pretty hard core fisher girl.......she's driven to fish!! Keep her at it!!  Sinker
Loving the family reports cliff! It seems that we're seeing less and less of you with a fish  Congrats Sydney for the PB!
Great report Cliff, thanks.  And congrats to your daughter on the new PB and her first Angler Award
A beautiful report once again with the family.....pretty soon Cliff your  not going to have any time to fish......you'll be too busy using the net  Jason
Thanks for the report and the bubble trick!

Thanks to all for your replies.  To those of you who mentioned something about me being net boy for all the gals in the family....or getting used to being outfished by them, I have to tell you....  I'm already used to it....LOL.
